ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I developed my ability to listen and speak in Chinese very much. It's a very intensive but rewarding course.
A lot of practice in speaking, listening, reading and writing in Chinese, improved especially a lot in reading comprehension since we got to learn so many vocab.
Improved my fluency in Chinese, especially more formal registers and literary language.
This is the most impressive chinese language program in the country. I learned more chinese than i could have anywhere else. Professors Wang and Zhang are a perfect balance of rigor and kindness.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Strength: consistent practice, engaged people and teachers Weakness: hard to notice significant improvement
The timing of the homework felt a big rough towards the end. Particularly, the skit was very stressful around finals time.

Daily homework workload has been a lot better than the fall semester, due to the changes in the quiz. I feel like we got to speak a little more this semester too (maybe that was because of the small class size of my section?), and the elimination of translation/traditional character was very efficient. Generally very well structured course, and you have a lot of chances to get detailed feedback.

The course is excellent; I can't think of any major changes to make. Maybe the only small thing to change would be to make the oral test questions and the TF tutorial session questions more free response rather than just summarizing the textbook. The changes made to the course structure this semester (such as changed quiz format, essay assignments, oral test format) were all much better than last semester and should be continued.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely! The Chinese program at Yale is phenomenal!
It's a great course to take if you love learning Chinese. From L3/L4 if you are not sure whether to take L5 because of the challenge, give it a try.
Yes, the Chinese program at Yale is excellent and this course is excellent.
